comment.text: We stopped in and sat outside and upstairs.  We had great weather.  The service was very friendly and efficient.  We ordered several appetizers, pizzas, and dishes.  Overall, we enjoyed ourselves, the service, and the food.  I'll be back.

We found this place randomly on yelp when we were looking to go to get some pizza and from the valet when you arrive until the time the check was dropped off everyone was very kind and filled with answers to my many questions. 
I came with my wife and my 4 month baby about 330pm on a Saturday and they made room for our stroller. 
Grana has the main floor which is very elegant and posh looking, then a second balcony style floor which is cute for a nice date night & a rooftop which is amazing for a more adventurous date night. 
We weren't too hungry and ordered the garlic bread to start which turned out to be like pizza style hahaha , it was DELICIOUS! 
We also ordered the meatball flight and I think it's going to be our Go to , when we come back! 
I'm excited to return without the baby and enjoy other items on the menu! 
Food, service, and ambiance were all great! 
The only reason I hesitated to give it 5 stars was because it wasn't toddler or baby friendly as other spaces of this style. 
I didn't go into it expecting it since we thought it was just pizza but for the style and options of food I expected it have a changing station for our baby in the bathroom but none of the bathrooms did, they did have a cute table I used anyways lol.

Hosted an engagement dinner here and will never host another event anywhere else! The service , from the beginning , was impeccable. The person i communicated with was super responsive and informative. The area was amazing and the food was even better. The pizza , the meat ball flight , the BRUSSEL SPROUTSOur servers were amazing as well!! Good food , good drinks and spacious area. Will definitely be back!

Everything at Grana was incredible! The restaurant has a relaxed vibe with plenty of indoor and outdoor seating. Our waitress was super friendly and very knowledgeable of the menu. We ordered the meatball flight, agnolotti pasta, and roni pizza. It was all delicious and I would order them all again! Our waitress was so sweet and gave us two cannolis for dessert because we were celebrating a birthday. Both cannolis were great and they give you a little menu to pick whatever toppings you'd like on them. I'll definitely be back!
I didn't know that I needed a sweet and spicy sauce on a pepperoni pizza until trying the Roni at Grana. Incredible. It was a packed house, yet the service was excellent. I can't wait to visit again!

Recently, we went to Grana for brunch and it was absolutely amazing!!! 

We tried some new brunch items as well as some classic Grana specialties. Our favorite brunch item had to be the Crostini (with whipped ricotta, truffle honey, sesame seeds), but the bacon, egg, and cheese sandwich (with a whole burrata ball might I add!!!!) came in for a close second. We had to get our classic favorites, the Roni pizza and the Meatball Tasting, of course. We tried quite a few drinks, as well. All of them were very delicious, but surprisingly, our favorite  was a chai latte martini that our server suggested.

Our service was also amazing! From the hosts to our server, everyone was friendly and helpful.

We can't wait to go back to Grana again. Only thing that we hope for next time is that it will be warm and we can utilized their rooftop!

I am aware that my take may be uncommon, yet my party had an absolutely poor experience here. The only positive I can speak to is the food which was delicious and that the valet service was convenient. Our service was terrible. We were a party of 3 at dinner on a Tuesday, thus the restaurant wasn't its busiest. After making a small show of wanting to work our table from the waitress who first greeted us, our waiter made a couple of inappropriate comments, was shamefully absent (38 minutes between requesting the check and returning to collect payment) and even sat blatantly watching the football game while we waited for him - or anyone - to pass by to check in. As other tables were seated, served, and left, it then became clearer that maybe our waiter hadn't immediately put in our order because of how much time passed between our service but tables with different servers seemed to be better attended. It's unfortunate because just a few weeks ago I had a great experience at the Ashford location. This is a complete turn off and I cannot recommend or say that I'd revisit.
Amazing pasta in Atlanta. Service is quick and friendly. Ambiance is welcoming and homey for a casual weekday dinner, but also nice enough to dress up for a date night. Love this spot!!!

one of the best meals i have had in a while. grana is 100% worth the hype. the hosts were super friendly and chatty. kept me busy while i waited on my friend and we picked out what to order haha. my friend and i split the meatball tasting (a must), the crispy brussels, and the buratta. the meatball tasting was super fun and delicious! it was hard to pick a fav they were all so good. the brussels were sweet and savory a great combo also delicious. the buratta was great as well i loved the crispy speck it was a nice touch. for mains we just split both the vodka rigatoni and the fibonacci pizza. the vodka rigatoni was the best ive ever had no exaggeration. i would come for that alone. the pizza was great but got a little outshined by that pasta. of course couldnt finish our night without getting the build your own cannolis! i got one regular shell, one dipped. and the dipped one was immaculate. 100/10

photos.caption: build your own cannolis were insanely good

comment.text:
PERFECTION!

This restaurant offers a sublime dining experience that effortlessly combines a warm ambiance, exceptional service, and an exquisite menu. From the moment you step foot inside, it's evident that Grana is a culinary gem that goes above and beyond to delight its guests. With its impeccable attention to detail and a menu crafted with passion, Grana undoubtedly deserves its reputation as one of Atlanta's finest dining establishments.

Ambiance:
The elegant decor, soothing lighting, and contemporary design elements create a relaxed and sophisticated ambiance. The open kitchen allows guests to witness the culinary magic as talented chefs skillfully prepare each dish. Whether you're seeking an intimate dinner for two or a celebratory gathering with friends, this place provides the perfect backdrop for a memorable dining experience.

Service:
The service is truly exemplary. From the moment I was greeted at the door to the attentive and knowledgeable waitstaff, every member of the team ensured that my visit was flawless. The staff's genuine warmth and dedication to providing an exceptional dining experience were evident throughout the evening. The servers were well-versed in the menu, offering insightful recommendations and accommodating dietary preferences with ease. 

Culinary Delights:
The menu is a testament to culinary artistry. Drawing inspiration from Italian flavors, each dish is a harmonious blend of fresh ingredients and creative techniques. From the first bite to the last, every dish was a revelation of flavors and textures. The attention to detail was remarkable, with each ingredient thoughtfully selected and expertly prepared.

I highly recommend visiting this restaurant!

We came at a fairly quiet time during the week. From the outside it looks a little fancy and inside it is pretty relaxed. This place is mostly a nice pizzeria so we went for some garlic bread and Cesar salad instead. The garlic bread was more like a white pizza which gave us a sample of what the pizza might be like. We loved the mozzarella on top and the dough had a nice fluffiness to it. The Cesar salad was decent and enough for two small side salads. The server was polite and came to check on us a few times.

Grana is, has been, and will be, the best pasta experience in Atlanta. In 2019 I worked under Chef Pascarella at the White Bull in Decatur and saw the magic he worked on farm-to-table cuisine, so was thrilled to hear he was creating a restaurant centered around his traditional expertise-- Italian. 

Grana combines Pascarella's culinary acumen with his passion for Italian food. It's a step up from White Bull in its decor and scale, with open air pizza kitchens, lofted ceilings, and portraits of early 20th century Sicily as far as the eye can see. I wouldn't necessarily recommend the pizza since you can get similar artisan pizzas at Sapori de Napoli in Decatur, Fritti in Inman Park, etc, but the pasta really is one-of-a-kind at Grana. My personal favorite is the short rib, but anything that catches your eye will be amazing. 

Grana has become an Atlanta staple for me and my family, and I can't wait to check out what else Chef Pat will bring to Atlanta in future years.

Got to go gnocci and the serving was child size. For $23 it was a joke, it was good but lacked potato the main ingredient. Tasted more like cheese was in it. The short rib pasta obviously sits in a pot until someone orders it. Meat was salty and noodles overcooked. The potato pizza on the other hand?! Amazing! It comes with honey, pistachios, goat cheese, onions, simply amazing. I'd go back for the pizza alone.

I went with 3 friends and I didn't drive so I'm not sure if there were other parking options but we valeted. 
We started with appetizers for the table- Brussels sprouts and "garlic bread" which were both delicious. My friends each got a cocktail and I got the mocktail. I think everyone liked their drinks, the mocktail was a bit tart though, so just keep that in mind.
For food, one friend got the rigatoni which is supposed to be a crowd favorite and he really liked it. I got gnocchi and truffle pizza with meatballs to share with another friend and the fourth friend got the potato pizza. I tried a slice of the potato pizza; I liked both pizzas and the gnocchi.
To finish the meal off, we each did a build your own cannoli. I got chocolate dipped with cow's milk ricotta (filling) with chocolate chips on top. I'm not even a huge cannoli person but it was really good.
The inside is cute but I think the ambiance would have been a tiny bit better with dimmer lighting. I hate dark restaurants, but a slight dimming of the lights can change the vibe significantly. Our server was really good. It was everyone's first time there and he explained the whole menu and answered any questions without getting annoyed (you know those servers).
I liked everything we ordered! If I lived in Atlanta, I'd probably be a regular here. If I'm in town again, I'll seek this place out again for sure!

photos.caption: Garlic cheese pizza (top) and Brussels sprouts (bottom)
Menu for build your own cannolis
Chocolate dipped cannoli with cow's milk ricotta and chocolate chips

comment.text:
So many good things to say about Grana! 

The restaurant itself is beautiful and the atmosphere is great. The waitress that served us was very friendly and didn't mind sharing the "ins and outs" of the menu since it was our first time there. 

They are "famous" for their meatball recipes and boy how they did not disappoint there. I'd highly recommend trying the Meatball Flight appetizer where you can get a tasting of each one. The burrata appetizer was very tasty as well and did a great job feeding the table. Also, the pizzas were phenomenal. I personally ordered the Chicken Parmesan Pane and it was unremarkable. The chicken was greatly overcooked and the slice of bread that the cutlets set atop off was far too dense and unappetizing.

I came here to meet my family for dinner on a Friday, I arrived early and decided to check in and get the table before they arrived. When the staff told me that our reservations were at a different location, I thought I was going to have to drive all the way across town during rush hour. But they quickly checked to see if they could accommodate us, a party of 9, which seemed unlikely. The manager was able to squeeze us in, which was greatly appreciated since this location was closer for us. The manager and staff went above and beyond to get us seated and taken care of, so grateful that they were so gracious and hospitable! And the food was delicious, love the pizza! Will definitely be returning here again!

We love Grana. The meatball flight is our favorite. Our waiters are always attentive to us and recommend the best items on the menu. Sometimes there's a wait but they have a high top community table you can sit at if you don't need a personal table. The vibe is nice too!

My friend and I took some seats at the bar which was totally empty on. Wednesday night. Wine bottles up to $100 are half off on Wednesday so we shared one. I ordered pizza and my friend had some bolognese. We chatted with the bartender whom was very nice.

I came with some friends to take a meatball-making class and we had a lot of fun! We wish we were able to eat the meatballs we made, but they take time to set, so they served us some in-house ones. The Mommys (beef meatballs) were delicious!

We also got the garlic bread, brussel sprouts (caramelized and delicious!), ricotta crostini, and truffle pizza were my favorites of the night. I got the espresso martini -- they make them right here! My friend hyped up the build-your-own cannoli, so I got one with cow's milk ricotta (you have a choice of cow or sheep!), chocolate chips, chopped pistachios, and candied pecans. Yum!

Parking: free valet, just tip them!

I wanted to like this place, and I do. I just didn't love it. We came for a birthday dinner and had noted it in the reservation, but nothing was mentioned and I had to remind them. We were seated right away on the main floor (there is an upstairs) after valeting. The decor is nice and I loved the high ceiling and overall ambiance.

We started with the meatball flight, which was 6 meatballs. None were that spectacular even they claim they have the "best balls" in Atlanta. Ha! The entrees are shareable so we got three pastas, the squid ink, the rigatoni, and the cappelletti. The squid ink needed more flavor as it was a bit bland. The rigatoni was good, and the cappelletti was my favorite. The sauce was great and went well with the crostini we got. The crostini had sesame seeds, which was a unique blend that worked well.

this restaurant was delightful. despite being late for our reservation, we were quickly sat at a different area. the vibes were very nice and the restaurant was very clean. the service was very fast and efficient. the food came out piping hot and everything was really good. my personal favorites were the shot rib pasta (9.5/10) and the ricotta cheesecake (9.8/10)
this is a good spot for a date or just to get food with a few friend

Absolutely delicious! My friend and I went out to eat here as we were craving pasta and Grana 100% satisfied those cravings. We started out with wine and a meatball flight but we're quickly back to the menu to order garlic bread and each of our entrees. I ordered the Rigatoni while my friend ordered the Mafalde. Everything we ordered was completely cleared, and we didn't think we were that hungry! 

Our total bill was $130 including a 20% tip and the bartender was amazing! 

I recommend making a reservation as we ending up sitting at the bar but food was served fast and fresh! It was also all steaming when being served which is a big win in my book!
Fresh Italian food made from scratch with tons of flavour in every bite. The chicken was great and the garlic bread was so cheesy. The meatball flight was tasty as well. Love the mocktail.

This place was absolutely lovely. We had a fantastic time and our server was just the sweetest person ever. While all of the food was definitely great, some items REALLY stood out. Do not miss the garlic bread, it's a classic here for a reason. Do yourself a favor and get the rocket power cocktail because it was as strong as it was delicious. The drunk uncle pizza, has the gummiest vodka sauce and had us literally licking our plates. While the New Yorker pizza had a cheese pull to die for, it was quite alright and nothing too great ( a good regular classic). The rigatoni was pretty flavorful but again just usual. The tiramisu was on the pricy end but if you're feeling it, treat yourself cause it was YUMMMYYYY (idk about $11 yummy but still tasty). The canoli however, SOOOO WORTH THE PRICE. it's huge and costs between $5-7 based on how many toppings you add. SOOOOO FILLING AND SOOOOOO WORTH IT

photos.caption: Excited to try out Grana! Love the ambience already
The garlic bread and rocket power cocktail (BOTH DELICIOUS!!)
Drunk uncle pizza (SAUCE WAS ACTUALLY SO GODDAMN AMAZING)

comment.text: I've had Grana bookmarked for quite some time now. I was happy when I found a friend that likes pizza and wanted to check it out with me. We both already knew what we wanted to try which was the potato pizza and the Fibonacci pizza. Both pizzas came out to the table rather quickly and actually surprised us. The pizzas also weren't piping hot which could mean they weren't freshly made. Nevertheless it didn't affect the taste which is the most important part. I really enjoyed all of the flavors of the potato pizza the truffle honey drizzle really pulled all the flavors together. Next time I plan to try the meatball flight, cocktails, and the rooftop.

user.name: Madeline E.
user.address: Horizons West / West Orlando, Bay Lake, FL

comment.text: This was one of the best Italian spots I've ever been to. Their wood fire pizza was excellent. Service was good!

So many things to say about Grana! The restaurant is so beautiful and spacious when you walk in. You can't help but stare at the lighting fixtures, the bar, and the decor on the walls. The first two things we ate were the Crispy Potatoes and Caesar Salad. Great way to start off your meal. Keep in mind, they serve "family style", so the portions are pretty large. The next dish we tried was the flight of meatballs, so delicious. My favorite was the meatball topped with currant mostarda. Refreshing and savory at the same time - I loved it. For our "main course" we shared the Cavatelli with ricotta salada. The pasta was cooked wonderfully and the sauce was excellent. To top off our dinner, we did the build your own cannolis! Super yummy and a great way to end the evening. I highly recommend visiting Grana!

Visited Grana on a Sunday around 12:30. Had my 92 year old grandmother in a walker, plus two young kids. I was very worried about having to wait in line for lunch, but decided to take a chance. Glad we did, the valet let us park right up front and there was no line. Little hidden gem! 

The staff was incredibly helpful with getting grandma around and found us the perfect table! 

Had the food been great then I would've given 5 stars. However, the food was only good. They have extremely limited options on the menu, especially for a pescatarian, kids and grandma. The pizza was good, but hard. We also had a pasta dish and a salad. We went there for the pizza, but grandma couldn't really eat it. 

But, lovely location, ambiance and staff! Would recommend.

This was my second time at Grana. I do like their pizza! We went for their Appertivo hour (happy hour) which has a few of their pizzas in smaller than usual size for cheaper (12$) and selected appetizers for 10$. Our favorite was the veal meatballs and ricotta and preaches appetizers. The place is great and the food amazing for the
Value u get. I would
Recommend trying the spot for a good alternative to the already amazing selection in Atl. One less star as the hostess at the front stand (skinny lady) was very distracted and more interested in talking to her peers. Our server was great, attentive and food came by quick.

mid for sure. this restaurant was so hyped up on my tiktok and instagram and i was really looking forward to it, but the food is pricy and just okay. for $30 pizza and pasta i was hoping for it to be a lot better than this. i think you can go somewhere else for italian if you want it. maybe i just ordered wrong but idk

What an incredible meal.  Right when we walked in I could tell this place was awesome. Will was our server and was outstanding. He was very warm and helpful with the wine list and describing the food. We had a few courses with a bottle of wine and we were blown away. Everything tasted so meticulously created. Everything was made with love. What a beautiful first night in Atlanta.

BEWARE: there is no such thing as a "kids" pizza here and i was unknowingly charged $23 for a pepperoni pizza for my 2 yr old without any mention that all pizzas are the same and there's no smaller version for kids.

i asked our server what menu items they had for kids and was told about a pasta with butter noodles or red sauce and that they could also make a pepperoni pizza without the herbs and spicy honey. but it was not concretely explained that i'd be ordering the same pepperoni pizza on menu for $23, just with those alterations. to their credit, i was surprised how substantial the pizza was when it arrived. 

5 stars because the pizza is absolutely delicious. but the $23 pizzagate felt dishonest. 4 other adults at the table got pizzas, just saying we could've shared.

Absolutely AMAZING! We had the pleasure to be served by Matt and he was phenomenal. Amazing food, environment and service. The food was so fresh and they made it clear that everything is homemade. I would give this 10 stars if possible ;)

Cute Italian spot!

We started with the garlic bread and brussels sprouts - both were phenomenal. Also had the Fibonacci pizza which was delicious. Would skip the cavatappi pasta next time (a weird mix of too Al dente and too chewy) 

Great service, cute atmosphere, complimentary valet parking, and a rooftop! Would recommend the apps and pizza but skip the pasta next time.

Ordered the Margarita pizza and it was some of the best pizza I've tried . It's wood fire pizza and every bite was full of flavor, including the thin crust! Great atmosphere and enjoyed having a conversation with our waiter, Jamar! Would definitely return whenever we're in GA!

I am such a fan of this place. I came for the PACCHERI GENOVESE and it truly did not disappoint. I actually had to come back a month later to have it again. Parking is valet only which is a pain but all good. Service is always great here as well as Sara at the bar. The garlic bread was also phenomenal and I'll have to try dessert next time but I'd bet the cannoli are good too.
Service and seating were fast and friendly.  Rooftop bar seating is fun, casual, with tvs.  Had the meatball appetizer with a variety of great unique meatyball flavors!

user.name: Jennifer B.
user.address: Biltmore Acres, North Druid Hills, GA

comment.text:
Good service, great pizza, and amazing beer. Service was fast and accurate.
Can we ask for more?
Next time I need to try the pasta and the desserts so that I can confidently add a star to my review. Sarah, our waitress was professional and friendly. If you sit in the bar area you might be a little hot because of the powerful wood ovens right across.
Still enjoyable. Same owners as Bastone and yes definitely same quality.

Parking options are either valet or parking in the Sprouts parking deck and walking over, which is what we did. We went for a weekend lunch, so they had a brunch menu, which is somewhat different than the dinner menu. Rooftop was nice! There are fans, too, so that helped with the humidity.

Short Rib Sandwich- This was really good and unique. Don't think I've had a sandwich like this elsewhere. Wasn't a fan of the potatoes though as they were kinda crumbly and hard to eat.

Roni Pizza- Definitely shareable. There are 6 slices. I like the subtle sweetness from the honey. It's also on the cheesier side if that sways you either way. Overall it was good, but I personally prefer the pizza from Varuni Napoli.

Went her for a date night and the food was greasy! Service was great! Food came
Our pretty fast. Drinks are good too
Pizza was good. Broccolini had great flavor but a bit too strong. Pasta was good but also lacked flavor.,

I had a salad that was outstanding here and my bf and I split a pizza and he ordered pasta. Both were really good! They have great happy hour deals on select wine, drinks and certain dishes or pizza. Cute vibe inside at the bar and love the open patio on top. The service is usually fast and friendly.

Reservations: I would recommend these, we were able to book through open table the day of and were seated immediately for. a Tuesday night. The restaurant did not seem too crowded, so walking in may not have had a lot of wait either. I bet the weekends are very busy though. 

Parking: Though valet is complimentary, you should always tip, so I'll say that the parking is 10-15 dollars for about 2 hours. If not, there's paid street parking on the side of nearby establishments. I read some other reviews about the Sprouts parking lot, you could give this a chance too. 

Appetizers: We started off sharing the whipped ricotta crostini. This was a good and light appetizer of whipped ricotta atop a hefty slice of bread cut into two pieces (perfect for sharing), with some honey and roasted sesame seeds. The sesame added a new layer of taste and I would definitely try this combination at home since I love ricotta toast.

Entrees: 
1. We ordered the potato pizza, which came with pistachios, honey, onions and goat cheese. This was served quickly. The pizza itself is quite thin; but with the toppings and size, I think it's a perfect size to share between two people with another entree added to the mix. The combination of ingredients definitely worked and provided a unique flavor that I wouldn't normally recreate at home while making pizza. I will likely order this again. 

2. we also got the cappelletti minus the prosciutto. This was such an interesting dish. The pasta, almost ravioli like, came filled with a cheese mixture, and served in a buttery sauce. I think the sauce was literally butter. It was a bit too much, and as a sauce girl, I was slightly disappointed it wasn't just some sort of cream based/tomato based sauce that you could dip the pasta or pizza crust in. There was a good portion size of pasta being served and with the fried sage, it was quite delicious. I don't think I'd order this again though. 

Desserts: We got our build your own cannoli, which was pretty delicious. However, the cannoli was room temperature. I know this sounds weird, but every cannoli I've had has a cooler filling of ricotta which somehow elevates the taste. That being said, I  would probably just get cannolis from somewhere else if I wanted it (make the drive down to the Antico's gelato and bakery shop and get a cannoli there). 

Drinks: We ordered some sort of bee drink. It was good, I don't remember much of what it was like, but very lemony and sweets. Probably won't order again. They also have a mocktail with 0 proof alcohol I believe, this is awesome! It's priced about the same as the other cocktails. 

Service: Fast, efficient. Nothing to note. 

Overall, Grana was a great experience. I will be back but will not order the same things that I ordered this time. They have a good menu with vegetarian options.
If I could only eat at one restaurant for the rest of my life in Atlanta, it would be Grana. Great pizza. The best chicken cutlets.

The meatball flight and the potato pizza are everything! Go now! 

We didn't get the roof top seat like we wanted but the bar was great and the bartender make a great after dinner espresso.

I had a very good experience at Grana! I came on a Friday night with my best-friend and was told there was a 45 minute wait (which was expected), however we were told we could sit at the bar and wait much less. We only waited about 5 minutes before some spots opened up. The bartender that night was awesome! He was very sweet and attentive, my friend got pasta and I got pizza, we enjoyed the food very much and our drinks were very good! I just forgot the name but it was both wine and I believe tequila in it? Also I highly recommend ending your meal with a make-your-own cannoli, you can choose up to 4 toppings! Overall great experience and nice staff.

Everything we tried on the menu was delicious. The service was great and the atmosphere was perfect, not too loud or too quiet. We loved the crispy brussels and roni pizza the most. The rooftop is great on a warm night.

photos.caption: Garlic Bread, Caesar, and Crispy Brussels

comment.text:
Yes and yes....
Came here on a Friday evening around 9. We put our name down to reserve a seat and sat at the bar for a drink.  Maybe 20m later, we were seated on the rooftop.

It was vibey... the music was a good volume.  We asked that they turn on the TV since the playoffs were on. 

We ordered spaghetti and branzino with broccolino.  Everything was delicuous! Once my branzino came our someone came to the table to filet it.  The flavor, the seasoning  was delicious! I want to go back and get the pizza... ordering the branzino again is a must. 

Highly recommended. 

IG @ChrissyEatsAtl

Server was excellent and I loved the wine list. Food was pretty average. The meatball flight is a neat idea but they aren't different enough to really make it interesting, although the veal meatball was memorable. Probably the highlight for the food was the brussel sprout appetizer. We got the paccheri genovese pasta dish and the tartufo pizza, and they were fine but not particularly flavorful. Just doesn't quite justify a $130 food bill....

Just perfect Italian cuisine. Home made pasta, amazing pizza and the pizza crust... covered rooftop bar with cover. 
The only thing I'd ask is restrooms on all 3 floors...
